snippet: Authorities say criminals are busy preying on increasingly desperate Greeks facing a deepening recession and a rising unemployment rate.
abstract: Authorities say criminals are busy preying on increasingly desperate Greeks facing deepening recession and rising unemployment rate; Athanassios Kottaras, chief of association representing private job agencies in Greece, says he receives six or seven complaints every week from Greeks moving abroad for jobs that turn out to be nonexistent or exploitative.
lead_paragraph: Authorities say criminals are busy preying on increasingly desperate Greeks facing a deepening recession and a rising unemployment rate.

headline.main: Amid Recession and Rising Joblessness, Greeks Fall Prey to Employment Swindles
headline.print_headline: Amid Recession and Rising Joblessness, Greeks Fall Prey to Employment Swindles
